hotendHeaters.name: Stock Cartridge 40W 12V
hotendHeaters.notes: Legacy 12V systems. Higher current draw than 24V equivalent.

hotendHeaters.name: Stock Cartridge 40W 24V
hotendHeaters.notes: Most common heater. Standard for PLA/PETG/ABS. Adequate for normal print speeds.

hotendHeaters.name: High-Power Cartridge 50W 24V
hotendHeaters.notes: Faster heat-up than 40W. Good upgrade for high-temp materials.

hotendHeaters.name: High-Power Cartridge 60W 24V
hotendHeaters.notes: Standard for high-flow hotends. Better temp recovery during fast printing.

hotendHeaters.name: High-Power Cartridge 70W 24V
hotendHeaters.notes: Extended length. Super high-flow applications. Check heater block compatibility.

hotendHeaters.name: High-Power Cartridge 80W 24V
hotendHeaters.notes: Very fast heat-up. Designed for high-speed printing. Verify PSU capacity.

hotendHeaters.name: Ceramic Heater 40W 24V
hotendHeaters.notes: Drop-in ceramic upgrade. More stable temps, longer lifespan than standard cartridge.

hotendHeaters.name: Ceramic Heater 50W 24V
hotendHeaters.notes: Popular upgrade. Faster response and more stable PID than cartridge equivalent.

hotendHeaters.name: Ceramic Heater 60W 24V
hotendHeaters.notes: High-performance ceramic. Great for high-temp materials and fast printing.

hotendHeaters.name: Ceramic Heater 70W 24V
hotendHeaters.notes: High-wattage ceramic. Excellent thermal response. Check block compatibility.

hotendHeaters.name: Ceramic Heater 80W 24V
hotendHeaters.notes: High-power ceramic for demanding applications. PID retune required.

hotendHeaters.name: Ceramic Heater 100W 24V
hotendHeaters.notes: Extreme heating capacity. Verify PSU and wiring can handle 4A+ current.

hotendHeaters.name: Rapido Ceramic Heater 115W
hotendHeaters.notes: Proprietary integrated heater. Ultra-fast heat-up. Not compatible with standard blocks.

hotendHeaters.name: E3D Revo Heater Core 40W
hotendHeaters.notes: Proprietary Revo heater core. Not compatible with standard systems.

hotendHeaters.name: E3D Revo Heater Core 60W
hotendHeaters.notes: High-flow Revo heater core upgrade. Proprietary system.

hotendHeaters.name: Bambu Lab Ceramic Heater
hotendHeaters.notes: Bambu proprietary heater. Ceramic construction for stable temps.

High-Power.description: Upgraded cartridge heaters with higher wattage
High-Power.recommendedFor: High-flow hotends, fast printing, high-temp materials

Ceramic.description: Ceramic heating element for improved thermal stability
Ceramic.recommendedFor: Precision printing, high-temp materials, long print jobs

Ceramic High-Power.description: High-wattage ceramic heaters for demanding applications
Ceramic High-Power.recommendedFor: High-speed printing, large nozzles, high-flow setups

Integrated.description: Proprietary heaters built into hotend systems

heaterUpgradeNotes.pidRetuning: Always run PID autotune (M303) after changing heaters
heaterUpgradeNotes.currentDraw: Higher wattage = higher current. Verify PSU and MOSFET ratings.
heaterUpgradeNotes.wiringCheck: Heaters over 60W may need thicker wiring (18AWG recommended)
heaterUpgradeNotes.thermalRunaway: Ensure thermal protection is enabled after any heater change

compatibility.voltage: MUST match printer voltage - 12V heater on 24V = fire hazard

bedHeaters.name: PCB Heated Bed 200W 24V (235mm)
bedHeaters.notes: Stock Creality bed. Adequate but slow. Silicone pad upgrade recommended.

bedHeaters.name: PCB Heated Bed 200W 24V (300mm)
bedHeaters.notes: Larger bed, same wattage = slower heating. Upgrade recommended.

bedHeaters.name: Aluminum Heated Bed 300W 24V (310mm)
bedHeaters.notes: Heavy but typically very flat. PCB traces on aluminum substrate.

bedHeaters.name: Silicone Heater Pad 200W 24V (235mm)
bedHeaters.notes: Common upgrade from PCB. More even heating distribution.

bedHeaters.name: Silicone Heater Pad 300W 24V (235mm)
bedHeaters.notes: Higher wattage for faster heating. May need external MOSFET.

bedHeaters.name: Silicone Heater Pad 300W 24V (310mm)
bedHeaters.notes: Medium-large bed upgrade. Good balance of speed and compatibility.

bedHeaters.name: Keenovo Silicone Heater 400W 24V (250mm)
bedHeaters.notes: Popular Voron upgrade. High quality brand. Integrated thermal fuse available.

bedHeaters.name: Silicone Heater Pad 500W 24V (300mm)
bedHeaters.notes: High-wattage DC option. Requires beefy PSU and wiring. External MOSFET recommended.

bedHeaters.name: Silicone Heater Pad 500W AC (250mm)
bedHeaters.notes: AC powered. Requires SSR and proper mains wiring. DANGEROUS if wired incorrectly!

bedHeaters.name: Silicone Heater Pad 750W AC (300mm)
bedHeaters.notes: AC powered. Fast heating. Requires SSR and proper wiring. NOT for beginners!

bedHeaters.name: Silicone Heater Pad 1000W AC (350mm)
bedHeaters.notes: High-power AC. Professional installation recommended. Multiple safety features required!

Premium Upgrade.recommendedFor: Fast heat-up, high-temp bed materials, larger beds

AC Mains.recommendedFor: Advanced builds only. Fastest heating. Requires SSR and electrical knowledge.

pidTuning._comment: PID tuning guidelines by heater type

stock.notes: Stock heaters usually work well with default PID or quick tune.

highPower.notes: High-power heaters respond faster. May need more cycles for stable tune.

ceramic.notes: Ceramic heaters have different thermal characteristics. More cycles recommended for best results.

bed.notes: Bed PID takes longer due to thermal mass. Be patient.

tips: Run PID tune at your most-used temperature
Let hotend/bed cool completely before starting
Run with part cooling fan OFF for hotend tune
Verify results with M503 after tuning

thermalProtection._comment: Thermal runaway protection - adjust based on heater type
thermalProtection.notes: Faster heaters can use shorter watch periods. Adjust if getting false thermal runaway errors.

safetyWarnings.voltageMismatch: NEVER use a 12V heater on 24V or vice versa. Fire hazard!
safetyWarnings.currentLimits: Verify your mainboard MOSFET can handle the heater current
safetyWarnings.wiringGauge: Heaters over 50W should use 18AWG or thicker wiring
safetyWarnings.acMains: AC bed heaters require proper electrical knowledge. Improper wiring can cause fire or electrocution.
safetyWarnings.thermalRunaway: Always verify thermal runaway protection is enabled after hardware changes
